review_title: Warm place but has serious money issues
job_title: Career Services Coordinator in New Rochelle, NY
pros: Warm, caring, thoughtful staff.  Really and truly care about the students and go above and beyond to help them in any way possible.
cons: Underpaid and overworked.  We aren't in it for the money and the school is under water because of misappropriation of the funds -- but pay is under standards.

job_title: Head Math Tutor in New Rochelle, NY
pros: My boss was absolutely fantastic, always willing to work whatever hours were best for me, and listened to the complaints we had about the center.
cons: While I was working there the math tutors were sharing a space with not only the writing tutors, but also the SNR tutors.  We were supposed to have our own area, but instead they had all of us in one room in the library.  It was very cramped, and I often brought students to different undesignated areas.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in New Rochelle, NY
pros: Awesome co-workers, seeing the transformation in students, Some supplemental benefits are fairly resonable
cons: Poor salary,  high insurance deductions, no annual increase

pros: Non-competitive and laid-back atmosphere, especially during the summer months. I have had some great bosses! Liberal amount of vacation time. Flexible schedules to accommodate your life.
cons: Very resistant and slow to change. Not an awful lot of room for job or salary advancement. Not entrepreneurial enough in spirit or the education market.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Rochelle, NY
pros: The College community feels like a family. The campus itself is beautiful and students are wonderful, strongly believe in the mission, are full of life and eager to explore all realms of higher education especially our high need for nurses!
cons: There is no transparency. The College is currently under heavy scrutiny regarding finances. Employees are continuing to be underpaid and overworked. People are being laid off, offices are being auctioned or taken away, and there are still no answers.

pros: The college community is very much like a family.  People help one another, and are concerned about your well being.
cons: There's a glass ceiling for a lot of jobs, with little opportunity to be promoted.  Also there haven't been any raises in about 4 years - at least not at my level. Also many lost their jobs due to downsizing over the last year.

pros: Healthy friendly environment, very supportive colleagues, pro educational setting, diversity community,  specialize in promoting health and wellness
cons: limited hours, no clinic background for nutrition

job_title: Assistant Registrar in New Rochelle, NY
pros: The college has been good to me and my family throughout the years.  Overall, they treat their employees well.
cons: I have no cons at this time.

job_title: Assistant Professor in New Rochelle, NY
pros: Working with students that truly make an impact in the communities served.
cons: Poor leadership and financial management brought the entire house down.

pros: Good people. Nice environment. Great hours. Meet lots of different people.

review_title: Good Memories but in need of Major Changes
job_title: Laboratory Manager in New Rochelle, NY

pros: wonderful students, friendly colleagues, peaceful environment on beautiful grounds
cons: upper management unaware of problems that plague their population, money is squandered, lower management is not adequately compensated
